result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carrie Lynette Barone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Carrie Lynette Barone was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carrie Lynette Barone

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) signed and filed.  Copy forwared via email to Ms. Brown at WCS.
Confirmation obtained from Court Reporter Kathy Nelson that on January 7, 2016, defendant was committed to the Department of Health Services for a period of 2 years, 3 months.
Order for Placement signed and filed.  Copy sent to DHS Division of Mental Health, 1 West Wilson, PO Box 7851, Madison, WI  53707 and emailed to WCS.

Defendant Carrie Lynette Barone in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Conditional Release Hearing plan conducted.  Parties stipulate to the Conditional Release plan dated February 16, 2016 and requests the Court adopt the findings.  Court placed findings on the record and orders the conditional release plan.
Contact made with Attorney Ann Heaps to schedule this matter for a Conditional Release Hearing.  Matter calendared.
Proposed Conditional Release Plan dated February 16, 2016 received and filed.
for Conditional Release Plan, signed and filed

Defendant Carrie Lynette Barone in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  WCS Forensics Specialist Terrell Harris.    Deputy court clerk:  vk  Parties stipulate to the report and propose adoption of the plan.  
Filed:  Victim Impact Statement
Court placed findings on the record and orders the conditional release plan
Order for Placement, signed and filed
Predisposition Investigation Report, received and filed
Invoice forwarded to accounts payable in the amount of $843.75 to DR John Pankiewicz for services on 07-15,16,30-2015 and 08-03,05,06-2015.Copy in file.

Defendant Carrie Lynette Barone in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk 
As to Count 2:
Phase I   
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint and information as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that ifs she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
In Phase I Court found defendant guilty of Count 2.

Phase II
Court finds based on Dr. Pankiewicz report dated 8/11/2015. that the defendent suffers from a mental disease or defect and as a result the defendant lacked substantial mental capacity to understand the wrongfullness of her conduct and is therefore found NOT GUILTY by reason of mental disease.  Case adjourned for  hearing to determine whether defendant is to be institutionalized or released on conditions and for how long.
Court orders DHS to conduct a predisposition investigation.
Order for Commitment, signed and filied
Order for Predisposition Investigation, signed and filed.
Case is adjourned for disposition hearing in Branch 19.
Bail to continue as set. 

As to Counts 1 & 3:    Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered counts dismissed.

Defendant Carrie Lynette Barone in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19  Plea hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
